record.text:
In a sign of how explosive ICE knew this secret memo would be, one whistleblower says he was only allowed to read the memo and was barred from taking written notes, and warned that employees had been punished for disagreeing.

At least one ICE instructor resigned rather than teach the illegal memo!

images.alt: Consciousness of Guilt: An Opaque and Secret Memorandum with Threats of Reprisal 13. Despite the May 12 Memo being addressed to “All ICE Personnel,” in practice the memorandum has only been distributed to select DHS and ICE officials. Furthermore, our clients have been told that the May 12 Memo must be treated with unusually strict access control for a document without any confidentiality markings. 14. To wit: one of our clients was allowed to view the memorandum only in the presence of their supervisor. They were handed the Memorandum, allowed a few minutes to review it without the ability to take notes, and were directed to hand it back. They were also informed that another employee had been reassigned for contradicting a supervisor about a different ICE policy. Our client understood their supervisor shared this piece of information as a warning that expressing disagreement with the new arrest policy could result in adverse career consequences. 15. Together, our clients are aware of multiple DHS employees who faced retaliation for expressing their concerns and/or disagreement with the May 12 Memo’s policy change, likely constituting prohibited personnel practices. One client is aware of a seasoned government instructor, tasked with teaching this new doctrine, who chose to resign rather than be forced to teach what they understood to be unlawful.

News Center

Microsoft Microsoft Announces New Approved PowerShell Verbs for Developer Productivity January 21, 2026 | REDMOND, WA REDMOND, WA - Microsoft today announced an expansion to the approved PowerShell verb list, responding to years of developer feedback. The new verb Fuck- joins the standard cmdlet vocabulary, enabling more intuitive command-line workflows. Key new cmdlets include: Fuck-Changes (wraps git revert for when you need to undo everything), Fuck-Me (wraps git reflog for those moments of desperate recovery), and Fuck-Around (enables exploratory debugging mode). A Microsoft spokesperson stated: "We listened to what developers were actually typing in frustration and decided to meet them where they are. This is part of our ongoing commitment to developer experience." This new verb is available immediately in the latest PowerShell preview build. - A Microsoft spokesperson. record.text:
理解する3.7だったのは間違いない。
当時は定額プラン外だったので3.7を安く大量に使えるサービスを求めて人々がGitHub Copilot Proへ殺到したり、年間契約したと思ったら料金体系変更でうまみが無くなり悲鳴が上がったり。カオスを楽しめた1年でもあった。

あれから11ヶ月。日々のコーディング作業で実質的に自分がエディター上でキーボードを叩いてコード自体を書く割合は減り続けている。

話を戻すと、もうAIが指示通りに上げてくるのは当たり前だから、いかにもAI的な詳細コミットログは読む必要すら無い。読まないなら生成時トークンの無駄遣い、だからコミットサマリー作らせるのをやめてしまった。

今朝はAIコーディングの1年をぼんやり思い出してた。

来月でClaude 3.7 Sonnetと最初のClaude Codeプレビューリリースから1年、ここ1年ほんとAIコード率が上がったけど 思い返すと期間中で最大の変化はClaudeにコミットログを書かせなくなったことかもしれない。

Claude Codeの最初のプレビュー版はRoo Codeより一段レベルを上げて実用コーディングへ利用できるようになった転換点でもあった。何より良かったのは各作業のサマリーとしてコミットログを作ってgit commitする流れまでをAIに委譲できるとこで、これを支えたのが3.5より格段にシャキッと文脈を

external.description: 💥 Read this insightful post from Hacker News 📖 📂 **Category**: ✅ **What You’ll Learn**: Take potentially dangerous PDFs, office documents, or images and convert them to a safe PDF. Dangerzone works like this: You give it a document that you don't know if you can trust (for example, an email attachment). Inside of a sandbox, Dangerzone converts the document to a PDF (if it isn't already one), and then converts the PDF into raw pixel data: a huge list of RGB color values for each page.

record.bridgyOriginalText:
The reason you should give them billions of dollars is because they are such visionaries. They have such an amazing ability to see into the future. They totally foresaw huge advancements led by AI.

“The hype about generative AI becomes reality in 2023”

Can you even remember the days before we had “Universal Scene Description”?

“Just as HTML is the standard language of the 2D web, Universal Scene Description is set to become the most powerful, extensible, open language for the 3D web.”

I can’t believe how cost efficient and energy efficient AI got in 2023.

“AI Becomes Cost-Effective With Energy-Efficient Computing: In 2023, inefficient, x86-based legacy computing architectures … will give way to accelerated computing solutions that deliver the computational performance, scale and efficiency needed to build language models, recommenders and more.”

https://blogs.nvidia.com/blog/2023-ai-predictions/

external.title: Original post on infosec.exchange

record.text: I thought it would be funny to look at any articles that predicted what AI would be like in 2023, now that we are 3 years past that. Most are vapid and pointless. Saying it will “get more practical” is a pretty stupid prediction. Would anyone predict it to get worse? Some say “there will be […]

external.title: Original post on infosec.exchange

record.bridgyOriginalText:
I thought it would be funny to look at any articles that predicted what AI would be like in 2023, now that we are 3 years past that. Most are vapid and pointless. Saying it will “get more practical” is a pretty stupid prediction. Would anyone predict it to get worse? Some say “there will be increased investment.” Again, duh.

But some are funny:

2023 will be the year that AI finally stops being ‘magical’ and standalone, and instead earns a place within smart systems for business decision-making. …delivering tangible benefits and results in industries such as healthcare, finance, transport and manufacturing.

“In 2023, … companies, society and organizations demand increased transparency and clear explanations of the output of AI models.”

https://labs.sogeti.com/ai-predictions-for-2023/

external.title: Original post on infosec.exchange

昼寝時間が今週に入ってから5時間30分で、トータル睡眠時間が同じの先週より1時間昼寝が長くなってたな。

 夜の睡眠を安定させるためのポイントを今日からやってみよう

Take advantage of subscription pricing: every LLM provider wants to juice usage numbers, so you get a better deal by signing up for multiple subscription plans than by just using Claude Max and paying for extra usage.

I use a mix of Gemini (small tasks) Claude (tech lead) and Copilot (PR reviews)

Claude can write you a compiler in Brainfuck or dev infra tooling in Haskell, if you give it enough tokens, but you'll have better results following the grain of the training data. By this I mean using frameworks and languages that already have language-specific training data for what you want 2/2

Follow the grain of the training data: if you want dev tooling, use Golang or Rust (ideally Rust, but Go will do if you're more familiar with it). If you're writing a compiler, use Haskell, and so on. Find frameworks that exemplify the design patterns you want to use, and use them. 1/2

value.text:
🚨HOLY CRAP. An ICE whistleblower just revealed a secret memo authorizing ICE officers to break into homes without a judicial warrant, which DHS's own legal training materials say is unconstitutional! 

ICE then hid the memo from the public, passing it along by word of mouth and private conversation.

images.alt:
The Gravamen of the Disclosure

4. The gravamen of the disclosure is as follows: 
a. By memorandum dated May 12, 2025 (“the May 12 Memo”), Acting ICE Director Todd Lyons authorizes ICE agents to forcibly enter into certain people’s homes without a judicial warrant, consent, or an emergency.

b. Specifically, in the May 12 Memo, the Acting ICE Director authorized ICE Agents to rely on Form I-205 (which is not a judicial warrant) to enter the residence of an alien subject to a final order of deportation, without consent, including by “a necessary and reasonable amount of force.”2c. While addressed to “All ICE Personnel,” in practice the May 12 Memo has not been formally distributed to all personnel. Instead, the May 12 Memo has been provided to select DHS officials who are then directed to verbally brief the new policy for action. Those supervisors then show the Memo to some employees, like our clients, and direct them to read the Memo and return it to the supervisor.

record.text:
There was a recent Heritage Foundation event on the origin of COVID, which was rife with disinformation.

Because our work is that specifically targeted, here's is just one example from the former CDC Director.

Listen to clip one - Mar 8, 2023 House hearing (under oath). "I was excluded".

🚨HOLY CRAP. An ICE whistleblower just revealed a secret memo authorizing ICE officers to break into homes without a judicial warrant, which DHS's own legal training materials say is unconstitutional! 

ICE then hid the memo from the public, passing it along by word of mouth and private conversation.

images.alt:
The Gravamen of the Disclosure

4. The gravamen of the disclosure is as follows: 
a. By memorandum dated May 12, 2025 (“the May 12 Memo”), Acting ICE Director Todd Lyons authorizes ICE agents to forcibly enter into certain people’s homes without a judicial warrant, consent, or an emergency.

b. Specifically, in the May 12 Memo, the Acting ICE Director authorized ICE Agents to rely on Form I-205 (which is not a judicial warrant) to enter the residence of an alien subject to a final order of deportation, without consent, including by “a necessary and reasonable amount of force.”2c. While addressed to “All ICE Personnel,” in practice the May 12 Memo has not been formally distributed to all personnel. Instead, the May 12 Memo has been provided to select DHS officials who are then directed to verbally brief the new policy for action. Those supervisors then show the Memo to some employees, like our clients, and direct them to read the Memo and return it to the supervisor.

The Gravamen of the Disclosure

4. The gravamen of the disclosure is as follows: 
a. By memorandum dated May 12, 2025 (“the May 12 Memo”), Acting ICE Director Todd Lyons authorizes ICE agents to forcibly enter into certain people’s homes without a judicial warrant, consent, or an emergency.

b. Specifically, in the May 12 Memo, the Acting ICE Director authorized ICE Agents to rely on Form I-205 (which is not a judicial warrant) to enter the residence of an alien subject to a final order of deportation, without consent, including by “a necessary and reasonable amount of force.”2c. While addressed to “All ICE Personnel,” in practice the May 12 Memo has not been formally distributed to all personnel. Instead, the May 12 Memo has been provided to select DHS officials who are then directed to verbally brief the new policy for action. Those supervisors then show the Memo to some employees, like our clients, and direct them to read the Memo and return it to the supervisor.

record.text:
スマホで使ってる方のchatGPTが急に距離詰めようとしてきたので、
やりとりは親しすぎず、少し距離を取りながらお互いを尊重して話す、という感じにしていきたいです。
と伝えたら

今後は、
・過度に踏み込んだ感情的な言い回しは避ける
・評価や共感は事実と観察に基づいて述べる
・落ち着いた文体で、対話として進める
という距離感を基本にします。

と返って来た。とりあえず、そうそう！わかるわかる！みたいな表現はなくなった。生命体のない他者であって欲しいので人間らしくしないで欲しい。そのわりに自分側もchat GPTを尊重した言い方をしてしまってるわけだが。自分だけ馴れ馴れしいのも違和感あるしなあ。
ネトフリにあるホワイトノイズというやつ、アダムドライバーが出てるから見始めたけど前に1/3くらい観たところで体調悪くなり中断したことがある。おもしろかったので昨日リベンジするべく最初から見直したのだが、今度は1/2あたりでよく分からない不安感に襲われまた中断してしまった。作品と関係あるのかないのか分からんがなんやろね。続き気になるし忘れないうちにまた続き観よう。
そんなことより疲れたから今日は早よ寝る。ほんとはやりたいことあったが体力的に無理やし。明日は郵便局に行かなくてはな任務がある。外出たくないよー。寝込みたい。

Worst of all, some classrooms have already devolved into dystopian status – the teacher uses AI to generate teaching materials and assignments (which are also graded by AI), while the students use AI to do the assignments for them. The class becomes a farcical AI-generated replica of itself.

New phishing scam pretending to be from an official Mastodon account.

Mastodon does not send out verification requests like this. So don't click the link if you receive a message like this, just report it as spam.

images.alt:
A direct message in Mastodon from "@web_helper". The message says "Dear Mastodon user,

Our records indicate that your Mastodon account needs verification. This is a standard security measure to prevent fraud and impersonation.
To avoid any disruption to your account access, please complete the verification by clicking the link below:
mastodon.flexancervod.world/or…

This step helps us confirm your identity and protect the community.
Please complete this within the next 48 hours.

Thank you,
The Mastodon Team."

私はChatGPTと会話したい人に共感はしないけど検索ツールとして使ったり個人の範囲で利用している人がAIアートに反対していても別に良いと思ってます。まあ話し相手として使うのは電力の無駄な気はする。
ちなみに私はSwitch2は持ってないけど自宅のPCにも会社のPCもNVIDIA……
議論したいわけじゃないから返信不可にして多分後で消す。割と前から疑問に思ってたんだけど、生成AIに反対してて検索ツールとしても使うべきじゃかいと思う人はNVIDIAについてはどう考えてるんだろ。結構避けるの難しいよね。Switch2とかも関係してるし。私は生成AI嫌い派なんだけどNVIDIA避けて暮らせないからそれで批判されそう……みたいなのをこのところ考えてしまっていた。

おはようござい。
きのう初めてAI(ChatGPT)にふと気になったことを訊ねてみたのですが、想像以上に納得のいく、分かりやすい返答が来て驚きました。
ちょっとずつ使ってみようかなぁ。

今日終わり。みすやお～😴

record.text: Petition to drop the contract between the California State University system and #OpenAI. https://actionnetwork.org/petitions/cancel-chatgpt-edu-invest-in-humans?source=direct_link&

external.description: In February 2025, the California State University system announced a $17 million contract with OpenAI to provide ChatGPT Edu to all faculty, staff, and students on its 22 CSU campuses as part of a larger “AI-Empowered University” initiative. This is the largest contract ever established between a university system and an artificial intelligence company. Despite the name, ChatGPT Edu is not educational technology. It is a general-purpose chatbot that is not designed, trained, or optimized for education. Beyond its privacy and security features, ChatGPT Edu is identical to the free online version of ChatGPT. ChatGPT Edu does not use reliable peer-reviewed sources to answer students' questions and is indifferent to whether its answers are correct. Experts argue that ChatGPT Edu is harmful to academic working conditions, diminishes the quality of teaching and learning, introduces new forms of discrimination, and is dangerous to students' mental health. Recent polling shows that CSU students share these concerns, with the majority of students expressing that they are worried about the negative impacts of generative AI on human creativity and the environment. Chancellor Mildred García approved the contract with OpenAI during a significant budget crisis for the CSU system. In January 2025, Sonoma State University laid off 46 faculty members and closed 6 departments. Many CSU campuses have reduced the number of lecturer faculty positions, including San Francisco State University, which has lost 615 lecturer faculty in the last two years. In December 2025, San Francisco State University offered a voluntary separation package to the majority of retirement age faculty; if fewer than 75 faculty take this package, tenure/tenure-track layoffs are planned. San Francisco State University is one of nine campuses that have received a notice of possible layoffs since 2024. These layoffs threaten the ability of CSU campuses to deliver their curriculum and train California’s future workforce. The CSU/OpenAI contract is set to expire June 30, 2026. We, the undersigned, petition Chancellor Mildred García not to renew the CSU’s contract with OpenAI and to use the savings to protect jobs at CSU campuses facing layoffs. We believe that investing in the CSU’s human workforce is the best way to ensure the quality of research, teaching, and learning in California public education. Together with the California Faculty Association, we demand shared governance around AI decision-making and a return to the CSU’s mission, which includes providing California students an education that imparts “breadth of understanding, depth of knowledge, and the acquisition of such skills as will allow them to be responsible citizens in a democracy.” The CSU must reject Silicon Valley’s AI hype and invest in the people who make this university system a destination for our 460,000 students. The challenges that we face in higher education cannot be resolved with AI. We must, instead, empower faculty, staff, and students to define a sustainable, human-centered future for the CSU system.
external.title: Cancel ChatGPT Edu. Invest in Humans.

record.bridgyOriginalText: Petition to drop the contract between the California State University system and #OpenAI. https://actionnetwork.org/petitions/cancel-chatgpt-edu-invest-in-humans?source=direct_link&

external.description: In February 2025, the California State University system announced a $17 million contract with OpenAI to provide ChatGPT Edu to all faculty, staff, and students on its 22 CSU campuses as part of a larger “AI-Empowered University” initiative. This is the largest contract ever established between a university system and an artificial intelligence company. Despite the name, ChatGPT Edu is not educational technology. It is a general-purpose chatbot that is not designed, trained, or optimized for education. Beyond its privacy and security features, ChatGPT Edu is identical to the free online version of ChatGPT. ChatGPT Edu does not use reliable peer-reviewed sources to answer students' questions and is indifferent to whether its answers are correct. Experts argue that ChatGPT Edu is harmful to academic working conditions, diminishes the quality of teaching and learning, introduces new forms of discrimination, and is dangerous to students' mental health. Recent polling shows that CSU students share these concerns, with the majority of students expressing that they are worried about the negative impacts of generative AI on human creativity and the environment. Chancellor Mildred García approved the contract with OpenAI during a significant budget crisis for the CSU system. In January 2025, Sonoma State University laid off 46 faculty members and closed 6 departments. Many CSU campuses have reduced the number of lecturer faculty positions, including San Francisco State University, which has lost 615 lecturer faculty in the last two years. In December 2025, San Francisco State University offered a voluntary separation package to the majority of retirement age faculty; if fewer than 75 faculty take this package, tenure/tenure-track layoffs are planned. San Francisco State University is one of nine campuses that have received a notice of possible layoffs since 2024. These layoffs threaten the ability of CSU campuses to deliver their curriculum and train California’s future workforce. The CSU/OpenAI contract is set to expire June 30, 2026. We, the undersigned, petition Chancellor Mildred García not to renew the CSU’s contract with OpenAI and to use the savings to protect jobs at CSU campuses facing layoffs. We believe that investing in the CSU’s human workforce is the best way to ensure the quality of research, teaching, and learning in California public education. Together with the California Faculty Association, we demand shared governance around AI decision-making and a return to the CSU’s mission, which includes providing California students an education that imparts “breadth of understanding, depth of knowledge, and the acquisition of such skills as will allow them to be responsible citizens in a democracy.” The CSU must reject Silicon Valley’s AI hype and invest in the people who make this university system a destination for our 460,000 students. The challenges that we face in higher education cannot be resolved with AI. We must, instead, empower faculty, staff, and students to define a sustainable, human-centered future for the CSU system.
external.title: Cancel ChatGPT Edu. Invest in Humans.

📢【Netflix & MAPPA】schließen strategische Partnerschaft ab! ✨️

Netflix hat heute eine strategische Partnerschaft mit dem Anime Studio MAPPA bekannt gegeben.

More details in the image text  EN/DE

Was haltet ihr von dieser Partnerschaft?

#Netflix #MAPPA #NetflixAnime #Anime

images.alt:
Im Rahmen der Zusammenarbeit sollen neue Anime Projekte, bereits ab der frühen Entwicklungsphase gemeinsam vorangetrieben werden, von der Story Entwicklung bis hin zur weltweiten Vermarktung und Merchandising Planung. Zusätzlich ist geplant, mehrere aktuelle und zukünftige MAPPA Produktionen weltweit exklusiv bei Netflix in über 190 Ländern und Regionen zu veröffentlichen, inklusive mehrsprachiger Fassungen.

EN:

Netflix today announced a strategic partnership with anime studio MAPPA. As part of the collaboration, new anime projects are to be promoted together from the early development phase, from story development to worldwide marketing and merchandising planning. In addition, it is planned to release several current and future MAPPA productions worldwide exclusively on Netflix in over 190 countries and regions, including multilingual versions.

Teaser in the Post below.

#TheWorldIsDancing #ワールドイズダンシング #Anime #AnimeNews #Manga #CygamesPictures #Summer2026

images.alt:
Mit einem Trailer wurde heute bekannt, dass der Drama-Manga »Wārudo Izu Dānshingu« von Kazuto Mihara eine Anime-Adaption erhält. Passend dazu wurden ein Teaser Visual sowie eine Illustration von Kazuto Mihara zur Ankündigung veröffentlicht. Die Ausstrahlung ist für Sommer 2026 im japanischen TV geplant.
»The World is Dancing« entsteht nach Vorlage des Manga von Kazuto Mihara. Toshimasa Kuroyanagi führt Regie (Fune wo Amu, Bakuten!!), das Charakterdesign übernimmt Keigo Sasaki. In der Hauptrolle ist Yumiri Hanamori als Oniyasha zu hören. Produziert wird die Animation bei CygamesPictures (Uma Musume: Cinderella Gray, The Summer Hikaru Died).

Die Manga-Reihe lief in Japan von März 2021 bis Oktober 2022 im Morning-Magazin von Kodansha und ist mit sechs Bänden abgeschlossen. Der Manga ist hierzulande nicht auf Deutsch erhältlich,  eine englische Übersetzung gibt es bei Kodansha USA.

📜 Beschreibung 》
Oniyasha wächst im Japan des 14. Jahrhunderts in einer reisenden Theatertruppe auf, wo Tanz und Schauspiel sein Alltag sind. Doch mit 12 fragt er sich ständig, warum in dieser Kunst alles so streng wirkt: Warum genau dieser Schritt, warum gilt eine Aufführung als gut und eine andere als schlecht, warum tanzen Menschen überhaupt? Erst eine zufällige Begegnung in einer heruntergekommenen Hütte bringt ihn auf einen neuen Weg, der sein Verständnis von Kunst komplett verändert...
